item.title: Michael Hausenblas on Container Networking
item.description: Michael Hausenblas and Kim Carter discuss container networking concepts from Michael’s book Container Networking. Covering Kubernetes, service discovery, orchestration, and many other related topics.

item.title: Natalie Silvanovich on Attack Surface Reduction
item.description: Natalie Silvanovich from Google Project Zero talks with Kim Carter about what attack surface reduction is about.

item.title: Péter Budai on End to End Encryption
item.description: Head of Cryptography Engineering at Tresorit, Péter Budai talks with Kim Carter about End to End Encryption.

item.title: Scott Piper on Cloud Security
item.description: Founder of Summit Route / creator of FLAWS, Scott Piper talks with Kim Carter about Cloud Security on Software Engineering Radio.

item.title: Zane Lackey on Application Security
item.description: Zane Lackey talks with Kim Carter about Application Security on Software Engineering Radio.

item.title: Haroon Meer on Network Security
item.description: Haroon Meer talks with Kim Carter about network security on Software Engineering Radio.

item.title: Diogo Mónica on Docker Security
item.description: Diogo Mónica talks with Kim Carter about Docker Security on Software Engineering Radio.

item.title: Kim's Career Story
item.description: Charles Max Wood interviews Kim Carter to find out more about his journey into programming and information security!

item.title: Francois Raynaud on DevSecOps
item.description: Francois Raynaud and Kim Carter discuss what’s wrong with the traditional delivery approach and why we need to change. On Software Engineering Radio.

item.title: Neil Ford on Success Skills for Architects
item.description: Neal Ford of ThoughtWorks chats with SE Radio’s Kim Carter about the skills required to be a successful software architect.

item.title: InfoSec for Developers
item.description: Carl and Richard talk with Kim Carter about his experience in helping developers grasp information security and successfully employ it within their teams.
